Trevor's answer is correct and there are examples [in the documentation](https://docs.kentico.com/x/EgiiCQ).
The Kentico Community Portal has [a newsletter and you can sign up for](https://community.kentico.com/newsletter-signup). Since the code base for the Kentico Community Portal is open-source you can [view the source code for that email template](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.7.0.4/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/App_Data/CIRepository/%40global/emaillibrary.emailtemplate/communitynewsletter.xml#L6) as an example of macro usage.
It's also worth noting that we are planning to release a native visual [Email Builder in our February Refresh](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/258-create-emails-using-the-email-builder) and potentially some improvements to the Form Builder later this year.
